intro: Cynosciadium pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf cowplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered umbels of white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in wetland environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the stems are often hairy. Cynosciadium pumilum is often found in swamps, marshes, and along the edges of ponds.
